sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react' import { Title, FormButton, FormInput, WeatherInfoItem } from './components' import './index.css' const App = () => { const [weatherData, setWeatherData] = useState({}) const [city, setCity] = useState('') console.log(weatherData) const API_KEY = 'f5c340f67db5b02bb40d79f20a1bc03e' const API = 'https://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather?' const fetchWeather = (event) => { event.preventDefault() fetch(`${API}appid=${API_KEY}&q=${city}&units=metric`) .then(res => res.json()) .then((data) => setWeatherData(data)) .catch((err) => console.error(err)) } const searchInputHandler = (event) => { setCity(event.target.value) } return (
<form className='form' onSubmit={fetchWeather}> <div className='searchBox'> <FormInput onChange={searchInputHandler} placeholder="search city..." /> <FormButton /> </div> </form> <div className="container"> <WeatherInfoItem title='City' info={weatherData.name}/> <WeatherInfoItem title='Temperature' info={`${weatherData?.name?.temp} ℃`}/> <WeatherInfoItem title='Pressure' info={weatherData?.name?.pressure}/> <WeatherInfoItem title='Coty' info={weatherData.name}/> </div> </div> ) } export default App
